Use of Maven Profiles

  • Running FitNesse
    • Run FitNesse As A Wiki Server ('wiki mode')
    • Run FitNesse Automated Integration Tests ('auto mode')
  • Use of Maven Profiles
    • For FitNesse As A Wiki Server
    • For FitNesse Automated Integration Tests
    • To Skip FitNesse Testing Altogether
    • Example Profile Configuration
  • Filtering Test Suites
    • Specifying A Suite Or Test
    • Include / Exclude Filtering Using FitNesse Tags

Because it doesn't make sense to run both FitNesse as a wiki server and as automated integration tests at the same time, all of the example projects use Maven Profiles to separate the two configurations.

For FitNesse As A Wiki Server

Using the <profiles> configuration given below, run Maven with:

mvn verify -P wiki

For FitNesse Automated Integration Tests

Using the <profiles> configuration given below, run Maven with:

mvn verify -P auto

To Skip FitNesse Testing Altogether (but perhaps to still run other integration tests)

Using the <profiles> configuration given below, run Maven with:

mvn verify

Example Profile Configuration

<project>
    [...]
    <profiles>
        <profile>
            <id>wiki</id>
            <build>
                <plugins>
                    <plugin>
                        <groupId>uk.co.javahelp.fitnesse</groupId>
                        <artifactId>fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                        <executions>
                            <execution>
                                <goals>
                                    <goal>set-up</goal>
                                    <goal>wiki</goal>
                                    <goal>tear-down</goal>
                                </goals>
                            </execution>
                        </executions>
                    </plugin>
                </plugins>
            </build>
        </profile>
        <profile>
            <id>auto</id>
            <build>
                <plugins>
                    <plugin>
                        <groupId>uk.co.javahelp.fitnesse</groupId>
                        <artifactId>fitnesse-launcher-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                        <executions>
                            <execution>
                                <goals>
                                    <goal>set-up</goal>
                                    <goal>run-tests</goal>
                                    <goal>tear-down</goal>
                                    <goal>verify</goal>
                                </goals>
                            </execution>
                        </executions>
                    </plugin>
                </plugins>
            </build>
        </profile>
    </profiles>
    [...]
</project>
